definition[0]: the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop etc, especially using violence
example[0]: Police are investigating a series of bank robberies in South Wales.
example[1]: He received a 10 year prison sentence for armed robbery (=robbery using a gun).
example[2]: He admitted attempted robbery and was given a suspended sentence.
definition[1]: the crime of stealing money or other things from a bank, shop etc, especially by using threats or violence
example[3]: Mobile phones are a common target in street robberies.
example[4]: Armed robbery is a serious offence.
definition[2]: the crime of stealing something, especially when the person they are stolen from is not present
example[5]: Car thefts are on the increase.
example[6]: Security has been tightened since the theft of a $150,000 oil painting.
definition[3]: the crime of entering a house or other building illegally and stealing things
example[7]: Most burglaries occur when a house or apartment is empty.
definition[4]: an occasion when someone breaks a door or window in order to enter a place and steal things
example[9]: The break-in was the eighth on our street this year.
example[10]: Thereâ€™s been a break-in at the newsagents.
definition[5]: a violent attack on someone in the street in order to rob them
example[11]: There have been a number of muggings outside downtown hotels.
definition[6]: an attack on a bank, shop etc, especially one in which the thieves use weapons
example[12]: The gang carried out an armed raid on a post office.
definition[7]: a carefully planned robbery of a bank
example[13]: The money from the bank job was quickly taken out of the country.
definition[8]: the crime of stealing something from someone, without using force or threats. This word is used mainly in American English. It is now old-fashioned in British English
example[14]: He pleaded guilty in New York to nine counts of grand larceny  (=stealing things that are worth a lot of money).
example[15]: They were suspected of being involved in petty larceny  (=stealing things that are not worth a lot of money).
